no.ntnu.fp.net.co
Class ConnectionImpl

java.lang.Object
  no.ntnu.fp.net.co.AbstractConnection
      no.ntnu.fp.net.co.ConnectionImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Connection
public class ConnectionImpl
extends AbstractConnection

Implementation of the Connection-interface.

This class implements the behaviour in the methods specified in the interface Connection over the unreliable, connectionless network realised in ClSocket. The base class, AbstractConnection implements some of the functionality, leaving message passing and error handling to this implementation.

Author:
Sebjørn Birkeland and Stein Jakob Nordbø
See Also:
Connection, ClSocket

                    int remotePort)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    java.net.SocketTimeoutException
Establish a connection to a remote location.

Parameters:
remoteAddress - - the remote IP-address to connect to
remotePort - - the remote portnumber to connect to
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If there's an I/O error.
java.net.SocketTimeoutException - If timeout expires before connection is completed.
See Also:
Connection.connect(InetAddress, int)

accept

public Connection accept()
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.net.SocketTimeoutException
Listen for, and accept, incoming connections.

Returns:
A new ConnectionImpl-object representing the new connection.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when waiting for a connection
java.net.SocketTimeoutException - if the timeout has been reached
See Also:
Connection.accept()

          throws java.net.ConnectException,
                 java.io.IOException
Send a message from the application.

Parameters:
msg - - the String to be sent.
Throws:
java.net.ConnectException - If no connection exists.
java.io.IOException - If no ACK was received.
See Also:

receive

public java.lang.String receive()
                         throws java.net.ConnectException,
                                java.io.IOException
Wait for incoming data.

Returns:
The received data's payload as a String.
Throws:
java.net.ConnectException - if no remote instance is connected
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when sending
